description:
From nova-network running rev 1526

It appears when building a bunch of instance, one of the instances in the group was not assigned any IPs, it generated this error:

2011-09-06 20:41:18,730 DEBUG nova.network.manager [67fe614e-802b-4506-8e68-d72836ec09cd ant ozone] network allocations for instance 9181 from (pid=28245) allocate_for_instance /usr/lib/pymodules/python2.6/nova/network/manager.py:431
2011-09-06 20:41:18,821 ERROR nova.exception [-] DB exception wrapped.
(nova.exception): TRACE: Traceback (most recent call last):
(nova.exception): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.6/nova/exception.py", line 78, in _wrap
(nova.exception): TRACE:     return f(*args, **kwargs)
(nova.exception): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/python2.6/dist-packages/sqlalchemy/orm/session.py", line 1346, in flush
(nova.exception): TRACE:     self._flush(objects)
(nova.exception): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/python2.6/dist-packages/sqlalchemy/orm/session.py", line 1434, in _flush
(nova.exception): TRACE:     raise
(nova.exception): TRACE: TypeError: exceptions must be old-style classes or derived from BaseException, not NoneType
(nova.exception): TRACE: 
2011-09-06 20:41:18,823 ERROR nova.rpc [-] Exception during message handling
(nova.rpc): TRACE: Traceback (most recent call last):
(nova.rpc): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.6/nova/rpc/impl_kombu.py", line 620, in _process_data
(nova.rpc): TRACE:     rval = node_func(context=ctxt, **node_args)
(nova.rpc): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.6/nova/network/manager.py", line 456, in allocate_for_instance
(nova.rpc): TRACE:     self._allocate_mac_addresses_hack(context, instance_id, networks)
(nova.rpc): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.6/nova/network/manager.py", line 605, in _allocate_mac_addresses_hack
(nova.rpc): TRACE:     self.db.virtual_interface_create(context, vif)
(nova.rpc): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.6/nova/db/api.py", line 405, in virtual_interface_create
(nova.rpc): TRACE:     return IMPL.virtual_interface_create(context, values)
(nova.rpc): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.6/nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py", line 119, in wrapper
(nova.rpc): TRACE:     return f(*args, **kwargs)
(nova.rpc): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.6/nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py", line 891, in virtual_interface_create
(nova.rpc): TRACE:     vif_ref.save()
(nova.rpc): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.6/nova/db/sqlalchemy/models.py", line 59, in save
(nova.rpc): TRACE:     session.flush()
(nova.rpc): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.6/nova/exception.py", line 81, in _wrap
(nova.rpc): TRACE:     raise DBError(e)
(nova.rpc): TRACE: DBError: exceptions must be old-style classes or derived from BaseException, not NoneType
(nova.rpc): TRACE: 
2011-09-06 20:41:18,826 ERROR nova.rpc [-] Returning exception exceptions must be old-style classes or derived from BaseException, not NoneType to caller

This occurred when trying to delete an instance that was missing networking:

2011-09-06 20:55:59,525 WARNING nova.network.manager [-] No fixed IPs for instance 9181
2011-09-06 20:55:59,636 ERROR nova.rpc [-] Exception during message handling
(nova.rpc): TRACE: Traceback (most recent call last):
(nova.rpc): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.6/nova/rpc/impl_kombu.py", line 620, in _process_data
(nova.rpc): TRACE:     rval = node_func(context=ctxt, **node_args)
(nova.rpc): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.6/nova/network/manager.py", line 538, in get_instance_nw_info
(nova.rpc): TRACE:     'bridge': network['bridge'],
(nova.rpc): TRACE: TypeError: 'NoneType' object is unsubscriptable
(nova.rpc): TRACE:
2011-09-06 20:55:59,636 ERROR nova.rpc [-] Returning exception 'NoneType' object is unsubscriptable to caller
2011-09-06 20:55:59,636 ERROR nova.rpc [-] ['Traceback (most recent call last):\n', '  File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.6/nova/rpc/impl_kombu.py", line 620, in _process_data\n    rval = node_func(context=ctxt, **node_args)\n', '  File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.6/nova/network/manager.py", line 538, in get_instance_nw_info\n    \'bridge\': network[\'bridge\'],\n', "TypeError: 'NoneType' object is unsubscriptable\n"]
title: IP address not assigned and instance cannot be deleted

comments.content:
From nova-network running rev 1526

2011-09-06 20:55:59,525 WARNING nova.network.manager [-] No fixed IPs for instance 9181
2011-09-06 20:55:59,636 ERROR nova.rpc [-] Exception during message handling
(nova.rpc): TRACE: Traceback (most recent call last):
(nova.rpc): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.6/nova/rpc/impl_kombu.py", line 620, in _process_data
(nova.rpc): TRACE:     rval = node_func(context=ctxt, **node_args)
(nova.rpc): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.6/nova/network/manager.py", line 538, in get_instance_nw_info
(nova.rpc): TRACE:     'bridge': network['bridge'],
(nova.rpc): TRACE: TypeError: 'NoneType' object is unsubscriptable
(nova.rpc): TRACE: 
2011-09-06 20:55:59,636 ERROR nova.rpc [-] Returning exception 'NoneType' object is unsubscriptable to caller
2011-09-06 20:55:59,636 ERROR nova.rpc [-] ['Traceback (most recent call last):\n', '  File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.6/nova/rpc/impl_kombu.py", line 620, in _process_data\n    rval = node_func(context=ctxt, **node_args)\n', '  File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.6/nova/network/manager.py", line 538, in get_instance_nw_info\n    \'bridge\': network[\'bridge\'],\n', "TypeError: 'NoneType' object is unsubscriptable\n"]
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~antonym

comments.content: I don't think this is possible any more, at least not in this capacity. Unable to reproduce anything like it, but I'll add some handling I suspect will solve it.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~cerberus

comments.content: I guess I mistook the bug to be about not being able to delete instances with no IP addresses, not instances not receiving them to begin with. Two parter.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~cerberus

comments.content: Looking at the code, it's changed so much from the time this error occurred that I'm not convinced it can happen in the same way. Rejecting
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~cerberus
